source: The below cell is creating the table if it does not exist

from notebookutils import mssparkutils

db_name: str = 'odw_harmonised_db'
table_name: str = 'pins_inspector'

@logging_to_appins
def test_table_exists(db_name: str, table_name: str) -> bool:
    spark.sql(f"USE {db_name}")
    tables_df: DataFrame = spark.sql("SHOW TABLES")
    table_names: list = [row['tableName'] for row in tables_df.collect()]
    return table_name in table_names

if test_table_exists(db_name, table_name):
    logInfo("Table exists in harmonised, updating the harmonised layer")
else:
    logInfo("Table doesn't exist, creating table first and then updating the harmonised layer.")
    mssparkutils.notebook.run("/py_odw_harmonised_table_creation",300,{'specific_table': table_name } )

# Check for new, updated or deleted data
- This script checks for new, updated or deleted data by checking the source data (horizon tables) against the target (odw_harmonised_db.pins_inspectors tables)
- **New Data:** where an main Reference in the source does not exist in the target, then NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Updated data:** Comparison occurs on Reference Fields in source and in target where the row hash is different i.e. there is a change in one of the columns. NewData flag is set to 'Y'
- **Deleted data:** where an Reference info in the target exists but the same identifyers don't exist in the source. DeletedData flag is set to 'Y'

## View pins_inspectors is created

%%sql
-- Build pins_inspectors_new table
-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW pins_inspectors_new 

     AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT DISTINCT
    -- CASE
    --     WHEN T1.horizonId IS NULL
    --     THEN T2.horizonId
    --     ELSE NULL
    -- END                             AS inspectorsId,
    T1.horizonId                    AS horizonId,
    T1.firstName                    AS firstName,
    T1.lastName                     AS lastName,
    T1.postName                     AS postName,
    T1.organisationName             AS organisationName,
    T1.title                        AS title,
    T1.salutation                   AS salutation,
    T1.qualifications               AS qualifications,
    T1.email                        AS email,
    "0"                             AS migrated,
    "Horizon"                       AS ODTSourceSystem,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from)  AS IngestionDate,
    NULL                            AS ValidTo,
    md5(
        concat(
            IFNULL(T1.horizonId,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.firstName,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.lastName,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.postName,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.organisationName,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.title,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.salutation,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.qualifications,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.email,'.')
        ))                          AS RowID, -- this hash should contain all the defining fields
    'Y'                             AS IsActive,
    T2.IsActive                     AS HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.pins_inspector T1
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.pins_inspector T2 ON T1.horizonId = T2.horizonId AND T2.IsActive = 'Y'
WHERE
    -- flags new data        
    (CASE
        WHEN T1.horizonId = T2.horizonId AND md5(
            concat(
                IFNULL(T1.horizonId,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.firstName,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.lastName,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.postName,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.organisationName,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.title,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.salutation,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.qualifications,'.'),
                IFNULL(T1.email,'.')
            )) <> T2.RowID  -- same row, changed data
        THEN 'Y'
        WHEN T2.horizonId IS NULL -- new data
        THEN 'Y'
    ELSE 'N'
    END  = 'Y')
    AND T1.horizonId IS NOT NULL
    AND T1.expected_from = (SELECT MAX(expected_from) FROM odw_standardised_db.pins_inspector)

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **pins_inspectors_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View pins_inspectors_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW pins_inspectors_changed_rows
    AS
-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 
Select 
    -- inspectorsId,
    horizonId,
    firstName,
    lastName,
    postName,
    organisationName,
    title,
    salutation,
    qualifications,
    email,    
    migrated,
    ODTSourceSystem,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive

From pins_inspectors_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'
SELECT
    -- inspectorsId,
    horizonId,
    firstName,
    lastName,
    postName,
    organisationName,
    title,
    salutation,
    qualifications,
    email,
    migrated,
    ODTSourceSystem,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
    
FROM odw_harmonised_db.pins_inspector
WHERE horizonId IN (SELECT horizonId FROM pins_inspectors_new WHERE horizonId IS NOT NULL) AND IsActive = 'Y';

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM pins_inspectors_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW pins_inspectors_changed_rows_final
    AS
SELECT 
    -- inspectorsId,
    horizonId,
    firstName,
    lastName,
    postName,
    organisationName,
    title,
    salutation,
    qualifications,
    email,    
    T1.migrated,
    T1.ODTSourceSystem,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM pins_inspectors_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View pins_inspectors_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the surrogate Key, EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the surrogate Key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised_db.pins_inspectors is updated

%%sql

-- merge into dim table
MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.pins_inspector AS Target
USING pins_inspectors_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.postName = Target.postName AND Target.IsActive = 'Y'

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows

WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT (
        -- inspectorsId,
        horizonId,
        firstName,
        lastName,
        postName,
        organisationName,
        title,
        salutation,
        qualifications,
        email,        
        migrated,
        ODTSourceSystem,
        IngestionDate,
        ValidTo,
        RowID,
        IsActive)
    VALUES (
        -- Source.inspectorsId,
        Source.horizonId,
        Source.firstName,
        Source.lastName,
        Source.postName,
        Source.organisationName,
        Source.title,
        Source.salutation,
        Source.qualifications,
        Source.email,        
        Source.migrated,
        Source.ODTSourceSystem,
        Source.IngestionDate,
        Source.ValidTo,
        Source.RowID,
        Source.IsActive)

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised_db.pins_inspectors is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new pins_inspectors

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.pins_inspector

SELECT 
    -- ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY inspectorsId NULLS LAST) AS inspectorsId,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY horizonId NULLS LAST) AS horizonId,
    -- horizonId,
    firstName,
    lastName,
    postName,
    organisationName,
    title,
    salutation,
    qualifications,
    email,    
    migrated,
    ODTSourceSystem,
    "Inspectors" as SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
    
FROM odw_harmonised_db.pins_inspector;
